de.intranda.digiverso.presentation.model.bookshelf

Class SessionStoreBookshelfManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.intranda.digiverso.presentation.model.bookshelf.SessionStoreBookshelfManager

  • public class SessionStoreBookshelfManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the bookshelf stored in the session store

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String BOOKSHELF_ATTRIBUTE_NAME 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SessionStoreBookshelfManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSessionBookshelfToUser(User user, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Assigns the curent session bookshelf (if any) to the given user and saves the bookshelf to the database The bookshelf gets a newly generated name provided by generateNewBookshelfName(List)
      boolean addToBookshelf(BookshelfItem item, javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Adds the given item to the session bookshelf, creating a new bookshelf if required
      Bookshelf createBookshelf(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Create a new Bookshelf and store it in the session store in the attribute "bookshelf"
      void deleteBookshelf(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session) 
      static java.lang.String generateBookshelfInfo(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String itemText, java.lang.String emptyListText, Bookshelf bookshelf)
      This embedds the bookshelf items within a text, to be used in autogenerated mails describing the bookshelf The parameter text contains the complete text with a placeholder {0} which is replaced by the text generated from the bookshelf items.
      static java.lang.String generateNewBookshelfName(java.util.List<Bookshelf> bookshelves)
      Returns a String of the pattern "List {n}" where {n} is the lowest positive integer such that no bookshelf named "List {n}" exists in the given list
      java.util.Optional<Bookshelf> getBookshelf(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session) 
      Bookshelf getOrCreateBookshelf(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Gets the bookshelf stored in the session.
      boolean isInBookshelf(BookshelfItem item, javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session) 
      boolean removeFromBookself(BookshelfItem item, javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Remove the given item (or one with identical pi, logId and order) from the session bookshelf if it exists If no session bookshelf exists, it doesn't contain the item or the item could not be removed for some other reason, false is returned

        public java.util.Optional<Bookshelf> getBookshelf(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Returns:
        An optional containing the stored bookshelf if one exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the session is NULL

      • createBookshelf

        public Bookshelf createBookshelf(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Create a new Bookshelf and store it in the session store in the attribute "bookshelf"
        Parameters:
        session -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a bookshelf already exists
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the bookshelf could not be stored in the session
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the session is NULL

      • getOrCreateBookshelf

        public Bookshelf getOrCreateBookshelf(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Gets the bookshelf stored in the session. If no bookshelf exists, a new one is created, stored and returned
        Parameters:
        session -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the session is NULL

      • addToBookshelf

        public boolean addToBookshelf(BookshelfItem item,
                              javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Adds the given item to the session bookshelf, creating a new bookshelf if required
        Parameters:
        item -
        session -
        Returns:
        false if the item could not be added (usually because it already exists), true otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the session is NULL

      • removeFromBookself

        public boolean removeFromBookself(BookshelfItem item,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Remove the given item (or one with identical pi, logId and order) from the session bookshelf if it exists If no session bookshelf exists, it doesn't contain the item or the item could not be removed for some other reason, false is returned
        Parameters:
        item -
        session -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the session is NULL

      • addSessionBookshelfToUser

        public void addSessionBookshelfToUser(User user,
                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                               throws DAOException
        Assigns the curent session bookshelf (if any) to the given user and saves the bookshelf to the database The bookshelf gets a newly generated name provided by generateNewBookshelfName(List)
        Parameters:

        request -
        Throws:
        DAOException

      • generateNewBookshelfName

        public static java.lang.String generateNewBookshelfName(java.util.List<Bookshelf> bookshelves)
        Returns a String of the pattern "List {n}" where {n} is the lowest positive integer such that no bookshelf named "List {n}" exists in the given list
        Parameters:
        allUserBookshelfs -
        Returns:

      • generateBookshelfInfo

        public static java.lang.String generateBookshelfInfo(java.lang.String text,
                                                     java.lang.String itemText,
                                                     java.lang.String emptyListText,
                                                     Bookshelf bookshelf)
        This embedds the bookshelf items within a text, to be used in autogenerated mails describing the bookshelf The parameter text contains the complete text with a placeholder {0} which is replaced by the text generated from the bookshelf items. itemText is the text for each bookshelf item with placeholder {0} which is replaced by the link to the bookmarked item, and {1} which is replaced by the title of that item. The parameter bookshelf is the bookshelf containing the items to be inserted
        Parameters:
        text -
        itemText -
        Returns:
